content.question: Which of the following best describes the importance of ozone in the stratosphere to life on Earth?

choices.label: Ozone reflects <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-rays from the Sun back into space.
Ozone absorbs most of the ultraviolet radiation from the Sun.

Ozone helps to moderate surface temperature by absorbing <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Ozone increases mutation rates and accelerates evolution in a variety of species.

content.answer: Ozone absorbs most of the ultraviolet radiation from the Sun.
